snippet: A scientific explanation has proved elusive, but evidence is building that the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill has played a role in harming the mammals.
abstract: Dolphins are dying in large numbers in northern Gulf of Mexico, with 1,308 dead or dying animals discovered since February 2010; some researchers suspect that April 2010 BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill has contributed to deaths.
lead_paragraph: A scientific explanation has proved elusive, but evidence is building that the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill has played a role in harming the mammals.

headline.main: Gulf of Mexico Turns Deadly for Dolphins
